poem:
Title: "Ode to the Ignored Warning"

Ten years past, we whispered of a keyless nightmare,
Soft alarms in corridors of industry, unheard.
Wheels turned, engines hummed, silence filled the assembly air,
As technology danced, with security's word deferred.

Now, thwarted locks and stolen rides echo our tale,
An unwanted ballet of metal, software, and disregard.
A silent chorus in the night, draped in aggressive veil,
Where the owners wake to nothing, their vacancy revealed.
